page.title: 08RECREATION IN BIGGLESWADE
page.content: The 12,000 people who live in and around Biggleswade enjoy a varied range of{clubs & activities}for leisure pursuits. Allotments are in demand & evening classes are always well-attended. Cubs & Scouts, Brownies & Guides all have local packs, & there is an Air Training Corps, Army Cadet Force, Young Farmers, Gymnastics and Youth Clubs for young people. The Townswomen's Guild and Darby & Joan Club are perhaps to be expected, along with the History Society, Gardening & Camera Clubs, but many specialist pas- times are also represented, including the Art Society, Caged Birds & Homing Societies, Old Time Dancing, Flower arranging, Dog Training & Model Rail- ways. Biggleswade & District Choral Society has performed several times with other local groups at the Royal Albert Hall in London.
